alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 7:08PM MDT until July 08 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL LARIMER COUNTY... At 708 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain had moved out of the warned area. Between 0.2 and 0.4 inches of rain may have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... A small portion of the northern sections of The Cameron Peak burn area, between Rustic and Pennock Pass. This includes the following additional locations... Box Prairie, Monument Gulch, Jacks Gulch, Lower Pingree Park Road and Crown Point Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads. People in areas prone to debris flows should be prepared to move to safety.
